pli-tv-bi-vb-pc94:5.1: 94. The training rule on not asking for permission
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc94:6.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc94:6.2: At that time the nuns sat down on a seat in front of monks without asking for permission.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc94:6.3: The monks complained and criticized them,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc94:6.4: “How can the nuns sit down on a seat in front of monks without asking for permission?” …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc94:6.5: “Is it true, monks, that nuns do this?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc94:6.8: How can nuns sit down on a seat in front of monks without asking for permission?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc94:6.9: This will not give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc94:6.10: And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule thus:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc94:7.1: ‘If a nun sits down on a seat in front of a monk without asking for permission, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc94:8.4: … The nun who has been given the full ordination by both complete Orders through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc94:9.2: in front of one who is fully ordained.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc94:9.6: even if she sits down on the ground, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc94:10.1: If she has not asked for permission, and she perceives that she has not, and she sits down on a seat, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc94:10.2: If she has not asked for permission, but she is unsure if she has, and she sits down on a seat, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc94:10.3: If she has not asked for permission, but she perceives that she has, and she sits down on a seat, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc94:11.1: If she has asked for permission, but she perceives that she has not, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc94:11.2: If she has asked for permission, but she is unsure if she has, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc94:11.3: If she has asked for permission, and she perceives that she has, there is no offense.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc94:12.2: if she is the first offender.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc94:13.1: The eleventh training rule is finished.
